creator: william.swayze@libertymutual.com
text:
When executing a batch or block of sql that includes a sql command that does 
not return a java ResultSet object, the output is not displayed or directed to 
the identified file.  The problem is in the boolean clause of the do while loop 
in the execSQL() method of the SQLExec class.  The condition should be (ret || 
updateCount != -1) to allow the loop to continue processing through 
the 'results' which may not be ResultSet objects.  An example is when a stored 
proc is called within a block of sql (Sybase: exec procname parameter list).
